questions: I have jury duty but am in a wheelchair how do I request and accommodation?
answers: If a person needs to request an accommodation the person, the person’s lawyer, or anyone acting on behalf of the person can request an accommodation. Tell us what kind of accommodation would help you to participate effectively in proceedings, programs, services and activities of the New Jersey Courts. While we might not be able to fulfill your exact accommodation request, we will strive to provide you with an equal opportunity to participate. For contact information regarding Title II ADA coordinators please refer to Judiciary’s Title II ADA brochure found at www.njcourts.gov/forms/10775_ada_titleII.pdf?c=vEb
